name: Firefox FlatStudio Tabs (like tabs-2.css)
description: Now with Australis support! This style makes Firefox tabs look like those in the FlatStudio GTK+ theme (without the rounded corner, as when tabs-2.css is selected in gtk.css). There is also a Thunderbird version.

additional_info:
For use with the default Firefox theme, both Australis and pre-Australis. This has only been tested on GNU/Linux. Please restart Firefox after applying this style, or updating to the 2014-04-01 update. If you are using Classic Theme Restorer or a similar add-on, please enable Australis-style curved tabs before applying this style. If you would like to hide the tab bar's bottom border, the navigation bar's top and/or bottom borders, and/or the navigation bar's background gradient, use this user style. Each of those settings can be configured individually in that style's settings. This was inspired by squid's Firefox FlatStuidoDark tabs style, but uses no code from it and does not require the GTK+ Native theme. The window theme used in the screenshot is Bar. This user style is licensed under the terms of the Mozilla Public License, version 2.0. Starting with the 2014-04-06 version, the source code for this style is also available in a Git repository. Changes: 2015-05-23 (bcd5a1a):
  • Fix the right margin on pinned tabs (was 1 pixel extra).
  • Adjust spacing between (non-pinned) tab icons and text in Firefox.
2015-05-21 (68a0af5):
  • Fix tab and tab bar height with Tab Mix Plus.
  • Fix miscellaneous small issues.
2015-05-21 (ebe46db):
  • Fix extra padding on pinned tabs caused by mozilla-central commit 666746987b4b.
2014-04-06 (e3dabf6):
  • The recent rewrite of this style has been ported to the Thunderbird version, and this update contains the changes necessary for it to work in Thunderbird, in order to allow for easier maintenance of both versions. (Converting between the two versions involves only a couple of regular expression replacements.) There are no visible changes in this update.
2014-04-05:
  • Add compatibility with Tab Mix Plus's show-tab-close-button-on-hover feature.
  • Use the new close button on the global tab bar close button if it is enabled.
2014-04-04:
  • The close buttons now use the style from Firefox 29, with one change: when not hovered or clicked, the close button matches the tab's text color.
  • The tab text color is now set on .tab-content instead of .tab-text. This also sets tab close button's non-hover/active color.
  • Removed the background gradient that appears on tabs in pre-Australis versions of Firefox.
2014-04-02:
  • Bug fixes.
  • Moar Numberwang.
2014-04-01:
  • Complete rewrite with simplified code that is easier to read and maintain.
  • Added support for Australis; pre-Australis versions of Firefox are still supported.
  • Now works with Tab Mix Plus's multi-row tab bar enabled. (Thanks to makondo for suggesting to not set the tab bar's height explicitly.)
  • Toolbar buttons are no longer styled specially, and the tab bar's bottom border is no longer hidden. If you would like to hide the tab bar's bottom border, the navigation bar's top and/or bottom borders, and/or the navigation bar's background gradient, use this user style. Each of those settings can be configured individually in that style's settings.
  • In Australis, the non-overflow-mode New Tab button is styled like other toolbar buttons.
  • License changed to Mozilla Public License, version 2.0, as I am now including (small amounts of) code from Mozilla Firefox itself, primarily to implement the change described in the previous bullet point.
  • Added a hidden Numberwang HTML5 game that appears randomly when you click the tab list button in overflow mode.
  • Known issues:
    • When scrolling to the left in overflow mode, pinned tabs will jump one pixel to the left and back each time the scroll button is clicked.
    • Tab close buttons have been Wangernumbed.
2013-05-22:
  • Disabled toolbar buttons are no longer highlighted when hovered.
2013-05-18:
  • Simplified tab background CSS: previously, the 4px right margin on pinned tabs was simulated by adding an extra 4px to the tab width and then using a -moz-linear-gradient to set a transparent background for these last 4 pixels of the tab and the normal background for the rest of the tab. Now, the tab background for all tabs is set on .tab-stack, and for pinned tabs, the extra 4 pixels are still added on the outer .tabbrowser-tab and the normal width (26px) is set on .tab-stack. This means that selected tab backgrounds are now set in one place instead of two, so it is easier to override this background using custom user styles.
  • Fixed icon position for pinned tabs. (I had previously fixed this for myself in a separate user style, so I overlooked it when I made this one.)
  • Set border-radius: 0 on .scrollbutton-up and .scrollbutton-down (fixes a cosmetic issue).
2013-05-15:
  • Better support for lightweight themes as well as user styles that change the background and text color of the tabs toolbar.
2013-05-03:
  • Initial release.
